alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 19 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Minor small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Cumberland and Oxford. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll, Coos and Grafton. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Minor small stream flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 635 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. This may cause small stream and brook flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in minor flooding through the White Mountains and into western Maine. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Naples, Franconia, Pinkham Notch, Mount Washington, and Waterford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Minor flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
